title: It’s Time to Junk the Furniture of the Last Century
text:
Last week, a column in The Wall Street Journal predicted that the television set could soon disappear from the American living room. Because young people watch everything on their laptops and phones, it seems inevitable that the vast, imperious, preening TV will go the way of the eight-track player, the pocket calculator and the carrier pigeon. The development, columnist Michelle Slatalla wrote, “will vastly improve the home decor of an entire generation of Americans.”

The seemingly imminent disappearance of the television...
description: If we can watch TV and read on our phones, why have giant flat-screen, bookcase or sofa?
